name: Deutzia
description: Deutzia is a genus of about 60 species of flowering shrubs in the family Hydrangeaceae, native to Asia and Central America.These shrubs have long, arching branches and 5-petalled, cup-shaped or star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The flowers are often fragrant and carried in clusters, usually rising above the arching shoots.
meaning: The genus was named after a Dutch botanist Johann van der Deutz, who lived in the 18th century.
color_description: Most species are white, but some are pink or red.
